content.raw:
Thanks, these look good to me!

I merged from default and regenerated the files with:

~~~
cd servicesim_competition/worlds/
erb s=100 urdf_launch=../../servicesim/launch/spawn_urdf.launch service.world.erb > service.world
~~~

This way, using the same seed, the only things that are changed in the world are caused by your changes in the erb. Otherwise, if we just use a random seed, the diff is huge and it becomes hard to pin-point the effects of your changes. This also removes the need to adjust the guest name in the test every time a new world is generated.

Merging!

cd servicesim_competition/worlds/
erb s=100 urdf_launch=../../servicesim/launch/spawn_urdf.launch service.world.erb > service.world

This way, using the same seed, the only things that are changed in the world are caused by your changes in the erb. Otherwise, if we just use a random seed, the diff is huge and it becomes hard to pin-point the effects of your changes. This also removes the need to adjust the guest name in the test every time a new world is generated.

Merging!
